page.title: 07Tourism
page.content: Middleham and the surrounding area attracts many tourists. James Herriot's books and television series have revealed its beauties far and wide. There are many guest houses, inns and houses offering bed and breakfast. Particular interesting land -marks are the castle built around 1170 on an impressive site over look- ing a small town. It is known as the 'Windsor of the North' and is famous for its connections with Richard 111. The stone houses are solid and impressive; many built of stone pillaged from the castle. Middleham Church dating mostly from the 14th & 15th century is very attractive. East Witton is a charming picturesque village with its green sandwiched between 2 rows of pretty stone cottages.
